newsitem.title: ISRAEL: Two Palestinians in hospital after Hebron clashes.
newsitem.headline: Two Palestinians in hospital after Hebron clashes.

text.p: At least two Palestinians were taken to hospital after clashes in Hebron between Arabs and Israeli troops on Saturday, witnesses said.
Hundreds of Palestinians gathered in central Hebron after Jewish settlers scuffled with Palestinian schoolchildren in the town.
Soldiers intervened arresting at least two Arabs and pushing demonstrators away from the approach to one of the Jewish enclaves in Hebron.
Palestinian witnesses said the soldiers beat several demonstrators and two were rushed to hospital in Hebron. One suffered a head injury, the witnesses said.
An Israeli army spokeswoman said she was checking the report.
Hebron is a flashpoint for Arab-Israeli violence and a sticking point in peace talks beween Israel and the PLO.

Israeli troops were due to withdraw from most of the town last March under a peace deal with the PLO but hardline Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has demanded modifications to the agreement to help protect Hebron's 400 Jewish settlers.
American Middle East envoy Dennis Ross was due in the region later on Saturday to push forward talks on Hebron which have foundered for the last 10 weeks.
